item.text: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent. (consideration: CR S4984; text as passed Senate: CR S4962)
Passed/agreed to in Senate: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.(consideration: CR S4984; text as passed Senate: CR S4962)

item.name: Social work, volunteer service, charitable organizations

item.text:
Congratulates the Medora Musical (a nationally renowned musical production of Western American patriotism) on its 50th anniversary on July 1, 2015.

Recognizes the remarkable talents and achievements of the many cast and crew members and volunteers of the Medora Musical who embody the true spirit of patriotism and stewardship of the United States.

Acknowledges the contributions of the Theodore Roosevelt Medora Foundation in preserving the life and legacy of President Theodore Roosevelt.
item.name: Introduced in Senate

item.text:
(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.)

Congratulates the Medora Musical (a nationally renowned musical production of Western American patriotism) on its 50th anniversary on July 1, 2015.

Recognizes the remarkable talents and achievements of the many cast and crew members and volunteers of the Medora Musical who embody the true spirit of patriotism and stewardship of the United States.

Acknowledges the contributions of the Theodore Roosevelt Medora Foundation in preserving the life and legacy of President Theodore Roosevelt.
item.name: Passed Senate without amendment

bill.title: A resolution commemorating the 50th anniversary of the Medora Musical.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
